author: world today news
title: Free Youthbuild Program in Union County Offers Education and Career Opportunities to Young Adults - World Today News
text:
Through the Hispanic Alliance for Career Enhancement (HACE) in Union County, the Youthbuild program offers education to young adults so they can finish school and move toward a short career or vocation.
Once they complete the program, students will be able to fulfill the goal of working in an airport or being an automotive technician, depending on their tastes and vocations.
They can also specialize in construction or receive certifications in Oshea and medical healthcare careers. Youthbuild is completely free and for young people between 16 and 24 years old.
It is available for 84 students, who will study in the program for 40 months.
How to apply to the Youthbuild program to finish your high school studies
Your first step, optionally, is to join the Hispanic Alliance for Career Enhancement network, by making click here . This way you can have access to all the events and programs offered by the organization.
And now Click here and formalize your registration to participate in the Youthbuild program. You will need an email, a phone number, select your main interest and other questions that you will be able to answer without problems.
Once done, stay tuned for any messages you receive, because they will contact you as soon as possible.
For more information , you can call 908-965-2400 or 908-965-2400 or use the email [email protected] to send a message. You can also visit the frequently asked questions section .
It may interest you:
How to Earn a GED or Equivalent High School Diploma
2024-02-29 21:36:00

author: Amos Khaemba
title: Agnes Kagure, Tim Wanyonyi Help PCEA Church Raise Millions During Fund Drive
text:
Nairobi Businesswoman Agnes Kagure Urges Leaders to Serve People with Humility: "Remain Humble" Sunday, June 02, 2024 at 3:47 PM by Amos Khaemba 2 min read On Sunday, June 2, businesswoman Agnes Kagure presided over a fund drive at PCEA Church in Utawala, Nairobi county Westlands MP Tim Wanyonyi participated in the fundraising, where over KSh 2 million was raised In her speech, Kagure called on politicians holding public offices to serve those who elected them with humility PAY ATTENTION: TUKO is in WhatsApp Channels now! Subscribe and read news in favourite messenger.
Amos Khaemba, a journalist at TUKO.co.ke, brings over three years of experience covering politics and current affairs in Kenya.
Nairobi - Businesswoman Agnes Kagure has called on elected leaders to serve Kenyans who gave them the mandate to lead.
Nairobi businesswoman Agnes Kagure helped raise over KSh 2 million. Photo: Agnes Kagure.
Source: Twitter What Agnes Kagure advised elected leaders During a fundraising event on Sunday, June 2, at PCEA church in Utawala, Kagure advised politicians holding public offices to serve Kenyans with humility.
PAY ATTENTION: Stay informed and follow us on Google News!
Read also
Kenyan Businessman Involved in Road Accident During Tour of China: "The Devil Never Sleeps"
"My message to the politicians who are in office now is to remember to serve the people who elected you. Always remain humble," Kagure said. Kagure, who was the chief guest at the fundraising event, which was aimed at raising funds to complete the construction of the church building, helped raise over KSh 2 million.
Tim Wanyonyi contributes KSh 100k Westlands MP Tim Wanyonyi also sent his contribution of KSh 100,000 towards the harambee.
Speaking at the same event, Bishop Edward Buri challenged Kenyans to wage a genuine fight against corruption, not just lip service.
According to Buri, most of the calls against corruption in Kenya only end at the podium, as politicians never mean what they say.
"A very important thing in our community is that we are running short of people in leadership who not just speak values but live them because we can all say integrity, we can all say anti-corruption, and we can all say these things. Read also
William Ruto Hits at Leaders Advancing Tribal Politics Days after Gachagua Called for Mt Kenya Unity
Any tongue can speak these things; even a lying tongue can lie about these things. But what we need is people who even sometimes, because we have too much speech going on, too much talk going on, now we even need people who don't talk much but live out the values much," Buri said. Which groups did Agnes Kagure meet? Meanwhile, Kagure vowed to scale up empowerment programmes across Nairobi county .
On Monday, May 27, Kagure held a consultative meeting with women leaders driving changes in the 17 constituencies.
Kagure, through her Agnes Kagure Foundation, wanted to understand the unique needs of every constituency before the planned empowerment programmes.
PAY ATTENTION: Unlock exclusive features from TUKO.co.ke - join our membership!
Source: TUKO.co.ke
Amos Khaemba (Current affairs editor) Amos Khaemba is an accredited journalist and current affairs editor at TUKO.co.ke. He holds a degree in Communication and Journalism from Moi University having graduated in 2015. Attended training by Google News Initiative Journalism. Has over 2 years of experience in the digital media industry. Previously worked at Kenya News Agency and Kivumbi.co.ke. Email: amos.khaemba@tuko.co.ke

author: Coralie Pierre
title: "Je ne sais pas si le voleur a compris ce qu'il prenait", une apicultrice se fait voler 10 ruches d'élevage de reines, sa colonie est décimée pour 2026
text:
Une apicultrice installée à côté de Faugères, dans l'Hérault, s'est fait voler 10 ruches de fécondation, appelées ruches nuclei, sur sa propriété privée. Elle lance un appel à témoins sur les réseaux sociaux et porte plainte.
"Je suis connue pour avoir (un peu) d’humour mais ce soir je l’ai perdu, j’ai la rage au ventre, une boule dans la gorge et les larmes aux yeux…".
Cette apicultrice et productrice de miel naturel de Faugères a lancé mardi 15 juillet dans la soirée un appel à témoins sur les réseaux sociaux. L'entreprise, un air de famille, gérée par Flora Pradier compte plus de 230 ruches productives et une centaine d'essaims qui vont le devenir. Mais elle a été victime d'un vol.
40 reines volées, soit 40 futures ruches
Flora Pradier s'est fait dérober 40 reines inséminées et fécondées. Et le vol semblait prémédité. Le ou les cambrioleurs d'abeilles sont venus se servir avec une remorque. "J'ai trouvé une balle de protection de la boule de la remorque", précise l'apicultrice dans son communiqué.
Un câble de cadenas a également été sectionné. "Ça ne parait pas beaucoup, mais ce sont des nuclei de fécondation, un vol d'une grande valeur puisque le vol de 40 reines équivaut à voler de quoi faire 40 ruches l'année prochaine".
Impossible donc pour cette apicultrice de renouveler son cheptel en 2026. Une perte financière qu'elle estime à 10 000€.
Dépôt de plainte
"Sache que je vais tout faire pour te retrouver et j'ai déjà commencé à te chercher!". Une plainte a été déposée mercredi 16 juillet à la gendarmerie de Bédarieux. L'apicultrice compte également sur le bouche à oreille des réseaux sociaux en lançant un appel à témoin aux "promeneurs, apiculteurs, randonneurs, vignerons, agriculteurs, chasseurs et amis des amis de mes amis Fabebook".
La gendarmerie a ouvert une enquête et a indiqué à l'apicultrice que la nature très reconnaissable de ces ruches pourrait être un atout. "Ces mini ruches ont été créées par mon papa et sont donc uniques et reconnaissables facilement. Je suis la seule dans la région avec ma sœur à marquer les reines d’un point blanc au lieu d’utiliser les 4 autres couleurs marqueurs d’années. Les reines que j’élève sont donc très reconnaissables".
En effet, toutes les reines nées en 2025 en élevage sont marquées d'un point bleu sauf celles de Flora, marquée d'un point blanc. Il pourrait être alors difficile pour le voleur de les revendre. "Je ne sais pas si la personne a vraiment compris ce qu'elle volait. Peut-être qu'elle pensait voler des mini-ruches".
Un phénomène de plus en plus courant
Flora Pradier avait déjà vu certains de ces confrères subir des vols, notamment l'année dernière sur le Mont Caroux dans l'Hérault. Mais pour l'apicultrice, si la personne avait été retrouvée, les poursuites ne sont pas à la hauteur.
"Le voleur avait écopé d'une amende, et n'était pas solvable. Le problème c'est que nous sommes dans une société qui n'est pas prête à défendre les abeilles comme il le faut". Alors la petite exploitation tente de s'équiper pour sécuriser l'élevage. "Nous avons des ruchers surveillés par des caméras mais c'est assez onéreux pour des petites exploitations comme la nôtre. Et surtout, ce n'est pas possible partout car nous avons des ruchers dans l'Hérault mais aussi en Ariège et en Provence".
L'apicultrice déplore que le voleur n'ait pas tout simplement demandé des reines pour démarrer son cheptel. "Je te les aurai offertes avec plaisir car dans notre métier il ne devrait y avoir que des valeurs de solidarité, souligne l'apicultrice avant d'asséner : tu ne mérites pas d’être au contact d’abeilles".
Une solidarité dont Flora Pradier semble en tout cas bénéficier puisque plusieurs personnes ont déjà proposé de lui donner des ruches pour sauver son cheptel de l'année prochaine.

author: Andrew Osborn
title: Russian stars' semi-naked party sparks wartime backlash
text:
World Russian stars' semi-naked party sparks wartime backlash 28 December 2023 - 08:04 By Andrew Osborn Many of the party's famous participants have recorded apologies, including journalist Ksenia Sobchak whose late father Anatoly used to be Putin's friend and boss.
Image: 123RF/ bagotaj
A rapper who attended a celebrity party with only a sock to hide his modesty has been jailed for 15 days, sponsors of some of Russia's best known entertainers have torn up their contracts, and President Vladimir Putin is reported to be unamused.
An “almost naked” party at a Moscow nightclub held at a time when Russia is engaged in a war with Ukraine and the authorities are pushing an increasingly conservative social agenda, has provoked an unusually swift and powerful backlash.
A video clip of Putin's spokesperson listening to an explanation from one of the stars who attended has been circulating online, and Baza, a news outlet known for its contacts with the security services, has reported that troops fighting in Ukraine were among the first to complain after seeing the footage and that photographs of the event reached an unimpressed Putin.
Dmitry Peskov, Putin's spokesperson, on Wednesday asked reporters to forgive him for not publicly commenting on the burgeoning scandal, saying: “Let you and I be the only ones in the country who aren't discussing this topic.”
Maria Zakharova, a spokesperson for the Russian Foreign Ministry, said that the event had “stained” those who took part, but that they now had a chance to work on themselves, according to the Ura.ru news outlet.
The fierce backlash from the authorities, pro-Kremlin lawmakers and bloggers, state media, and Orthodox Church groups has been dominating the headlines for days, displacing stories about rising egg prices and inflation.
The party, in Moscow's Mutabor nightclub on December 21, was organised by blogger Anastasia (Nastya) Ivleeva and was attended by well-known singers in various states of undress who have been staples on state TV entertainment programmes for years.
Ivleeva, who has since become one of Russia's most recognised names and who attended wearing jewellery worth 23 million roubles ($251,000) at a time when some Russians are struggling to get by, has issued two public apology videos.
In the second tearful one, released on December 27, she said she regretted her actions and deserved everything she got but hoped she could be given “a second chance.”
Her name has since disappeared as one of the public faces of major Russian mobile phone operator MTS, the tax authorities have opened an investigation that carries a potential five-year jail term, and a Moscow court has accepted a lawsuit from a group of individuals demanding she pay out 1 billion roubles ($10.9 million) for “moral suffering.”
If successful, they want the money to go to a state fund that supports Ukraine war veterans.
'CYNICAL'
“To hold such events at a time when our guys are dying in the (Ukrainian) special military operation and many children are losing their fathers is cynical,” said Yekaterina Mizulina, director of Russia's League for a Safe internet, a body founded with the authorities' support.
“Our soldiers on the front line are definitely not fighting for this.”
Many of the party's famous participants have recorded apologies, including journalist Ksenia Sobchak whose late father Anatoly used to be Putin's friend and boss.
The scandal comes at a time when Putin, who is expected to comfortably win another six-year term at a March election, has doubled down on social conservatism, urging families to have eight or more children, and after Russia's Supreme Court ruled that LGBTQ+ activists should be designated as “extremists.”
Nikolai Vasilyev, a rapper known as Vacio who attended wearing only a sock to cover his penis, was jailed by a Moscow court for 15 days and fined 200,000 roubles ($2,182) for propaganda of “non-traditional sexual relations.”
Other more famous names have had concerts and lucrative state TV airtime cancelled, contracts with sponsors revoked, and, in at least one case, are reportedly being cut out of a new film.
The scandal has angered those who support Russia's war in Ukraine.
One woman who said her nephew had lost both legs in combat wrote in a post to the League for a Safe internet that the stars should pay for prosthetic legs for her relative and others to make amends.
“That would be a better apology,” the unidentified woman wrote.
Reuters

author: Ashley Vargo
title: Department of Nutrition launches new human health degree track - AgriLife Today
text:
The Texas A&M College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Department of Nutrition has modernized its undergraduate degree in general nutrition. Launched in the fall of 2024, the undergraduate degree includes a new degree track focused on human health , and combines scientific rigor with patient-centered learning.
Impact Human Health Ready to make a difference? Texas A&M’s human health track equips you with the necessary tools to become a leader in nutrition and wellness.
See Program Details The updated curriculum, designed in consultation with the Texas A&M College of Medicine and Texas A&M College of Nursing , provides students a comprehensive understanding of human biology and the critical role of nutrition in health and disease, preparing them for a range of careers in health care.
David Threadgill, Ph.D. , University Distinguished Professor and head of the Department of Nutrition, said the change reflects the department’s commitment to meeting the rising demand for human-centered health education and equipping students for success in professional school.
“There are many misconceptions about what a degree in nutrition entails,” Threadgill said. “The new curriculum for the human health track was developed to better reflect how nutrition is a STEM degree focused on human health and disease prevention, emphasizing how nutrition impacts current and future health.”
Enhancements to the nutrition degree The human health track features a robust mix of courses in chemistry, genetics, biochemistry, microbiology, and anatomy and physiology. Students can also choose electives tailored to specific health care career paths, such as medicine, dentistry, nursing and more.
Additionally, the curriculum has embedded patient-centered learning throughout, preparing students for patient counseling in clinical settings.
The human health track’s interactive lab courses allow students to learn directly from medical sciences graduate students and engage with leading-edge technology like Anatomage tables. The experiential learning aims to deepen students’ understanding of complex anatomical structures and enhances preparation for careers in health and medicine. (Michael Miller/Texas A&M AgriLife) “Human health has always been the central academic focus of the Department of Nutrition,” said Lauren Coheley, Ph.D., associate department head for undergraduate programs and instructional assistant professor. “The new track aims to better align the education we’re providing to ensure students will be competitive when applying for professional school or graduate school so they can go on to positively impact the health care system.”
One new offering supporting this goal is the two-part course series “Nutrients and the Human Body,” which integrates anatomy and physiology with the role of dietary vitamins and minerals.
The course’s lab component gives students hands-on experience using Anatomage Tables — large touchscreen dissecting platforms featuring five digitalized human cadavers at high resolution. Coheley said these advanced tools, made possible by donor support, provide students a practical, immersive experience that enhances their preparation for professional environments.
Human health has always been the central academic focus of the Department of Nutrition. The new track aims to better align the education we’re providing to ensure students will be competitive when applying for professional school or graduate school so they can go on to positively impact the health care system.
Lauren Coheley, Ph.D.
Associate department head for undergraduate programs
Reflecting a health care focus through life science To ensure the updated curriculum aligns with health care and professional school standards, the Department of Nutrition consulted with faculty from the Texas A&M College of Medicine in course design. Graduate students in medical sciences were also brought on as teaching assistants for the human-focused laboratories.
Jeffrey W. Savell, Ph.D., vice chancellor and dean of Agriculture and Life Sciences , said the collaborative, hands-on approach to creating this track underscores the College’s dedication to developing graduates who are adaptable, well-rounded and ready to contribute to the promotion of healthy living through agriculture and the life sciences.
“The College of Agriculture and Life Sciences remains steadfast in its mission to provide students with exceptional opportunities in education through life sciences,” Savell said. “With the introduction of the human health track, the Department of Nutrition is shaping the next generation of health care providers poised to respond to the needs of a changing world.”

author: HispanTV
title: La guerra en curso marcará el fin del régimen de Israel, vaticina HAMAS | HISPANTV
text:
HAMAS asegura que el único destino que le espera a Israel es “fracaso total” además de destacar que la guerra en curso marcará el fin del régimen sionista.
En una rueda de prensa celebrada el jueves en Beirut, la capital de El Líbano, Osama Hamdan, uno de los líderes del Movimiento de Resistencia Islámica de Palestina (HAMAS), reiteró en que la batalla contra los ocupantes israelíes se considera una batalla de liberación nacional para todos los palestinos.
“Los líderes de la ocupación israelí cosechan fracaso tras fracaso” en la guerra contra la Resistencia palestina, dijo el portavoz de HAMAS para luego agregar que “el régimen sionista registró su fin político y militar con esta agresión”.
Cero avance ante HAMAS: Israel ni se ha acercado a las bases en Gaza Refiriéndose a los decenas de miles de palestinos asesinados durante los 83 días que pasan del genocidio israelí contra Gaza, el titular de HAMAS dijo que solo en las últimas 24 horas, Israel ha llevado a cabo 20 masacres “con armas estadounidenses”.
De acuerdo con Hamdan, la Administración del presidente de EE.UU., Joe Biden, intenta ocultarse detrás de una ficticia preocupación por los civiles, mientras “realmente dirige la guerra, y es responsable de la sangre que se derrama” en Gaza.
HAMAS tacha a Biden de “cómplice del crimen” en masacre israelí en Gaza
HAMAS: Huir o morir, es destino de tropas de Israel en Gaza | HISPANTV Osama Hamdan, uno de los líderes de HAMAS, asevera que el destino de las tropas de Israel en la guerra de Gaza es la muerte o la huida.
HAMAS saluda tregua “completo y definitivo”
En otra parte de sus declaraciones, Hamdan afirmó que están abiertos a cualquier propuesta para un alto el fuego final e infinito en la Franja de Gaza. “Nuestro pueblo no quiere un cese al fuego fragmentado o temporal, sino completo”, afirmó.
En este sentido, indicó que los líderes sionistas no verán con vida a los israelíes retenidos por los grupos de la Resistencia palestinos, excepto después de un cese total de su agresión contra Gaza.
Resistencia pone puntos sobre íes: No hay canje de cautivos bajo fuego También, dirigiéndose a las familias de los prisioneros israelíes, Hamdan declaró que “[el premier israelí, Benjamín] Netanyahu les está mintiendo porque bajo presión militar, vuestros hijos regresarán sin vida” .
HAMAS: 50 cautivos han muerto en Gaza por ataques de Israel Desde el inicio de la agresión israelí, el 7 de octubre, los indiscriminados bombardeos y la ofensiva terrestre de la entidad sionista contra Gaza han dejado un saldo de más de 21 300 palestinos muertos, la mayoría mujeres y niños, además al menos 55 600 personas han resultado heridas.
Israel bombardea una escuela que alberga a desplazados en Gaza mmo/mrg

author: 蕃新聞
title: 高餐大畢業生 前政院院長毛治國勉勵創新
text:
高餐大畢業生 前政院院長毛治國勉勵創新
創新聞/
15 分鐘前
【創新聞記者李堂安／高雄報導】國立高雄餐旅大學今年畢業典禮特別，擔任讚禮官的是陽明交大終身榮譽教授毛治國，毛教授亦為校長陳敦基恩師，兩人也曾在交通部觀光局共事，師生同台，象徵薪火相傳，生生不息，一同見證教育為百年樹人基業，世代交替開創新局。毛教授期許高餐大畢業生「思路決定出路，態度決定高度；挑戰孕育創新，問題代表機會」，勇於創新，不斷學習新知，日後拓展無限可能性。
產業界貴賓代表邀請到香港理工大學酒店觀光管理博士，身兼中華亞太餐旅觀光教育理事會(Asia-Pacific CHRIE)台灣分會理事長及慕舍酒店董事長，王劭仁，看似一帆風順的背後，其實有很多的辛酸，不吝和畢業生分享國中留級，一開始工作就被霸凌，創業第八年差點所有公司都倒掉，才剛開飯店，就在2020年，遇到疫情…，種種的不順都挺下來了，鼓勵同學要不計較，天道酬勤，永遠都不忘學習，字字句句發自肺腑，在場畢業生及家長十分動容，熱烈鼓掌。
容繼業校長應邀回校為畢業生獻上祝福，為現場增添溫馨氣氛，而應屆畢業生正好是陳敦基校長就任之初入學，正逢COVID-19疫情蔓延全球，新生入學時，校園迎新、授課型態與校園生活皆受到衝擊，如今能以隆重典禮為大學生活畫下美好句點，校長感性以「敬」、「競」、「靜」來和畢業生分享，敬業:追求卓越，敬天:尊重大自然，敬人:勇於承擔；競爭，和自己競爭也和別人競爭，與時俱進，不斷提升自己；靜，寧靜致遠，淡定從容；最後以「塵起塵落緣自在 人來人去情永在」，祝福畢業生鵬程萬里!
高餐大皆名列QS世界大學學科排名前50大，2022、2023年更高居全球第38名，國際聲譽卓著；在《遠見》「服務領域」大學評比排名亦居首，充分展現高餐人才的專業力與實戰力，讓畢業生步出校門更有底氣，張開雙臂擁抱世界，開創人生新篇章。
